parameters.definition: Maximum operational hours per year for the stand-mixer and the oven
Hours taken in the stand mixer to make a loaf of bread
Hours taken in the oven to bake a loaf of bread
Hours taken in the stand mixer to make a batch of cookies
Hours taken in the oven to bake a batch of cookies

description: A bakery uses a stand-mixer and a slow bake oven to make bread and cookies. Each machine can run for at most \param{MaxHours} hours per year. To bake a loaf of bread takes \param{BreadMixerHours} hour in the stand mixer and \param{BreadOvenHours} hours in the oven. A batch of cookies requires \param{CookieMixerHours} hours in the mixer and \param{CookieOvenHours} hour in the oven. The profit per loaf of bread is \param{ProfitBread} and the profit per batch of cookies is \param{ProfitCookies}. How should the bakery operate to maximize total profit?
